questions.question: Where did good harbors & forests, rocky soil & short growing season most impact the economy?

choices.answer: Southern colonies
Middle Atlantic region
Northwest territory
New England colonies

questions.question: The Virginia House of Burgesses and the Mayflower Compact were both created to

choices.answer: discuss post-revolution ideas for a governmental structure
create new forms of American currency
protest taxation without representation by the monarchy
allow new colonists to practice elements of self-government

questions.question: The Declaration of Independence was focused on exhibiting the principles of

choices.answer: direct democracy and women's suffrage
majority rule and minorities rights
consent of the governed and natural rights
limiting people's rights during times of national crisis

questions.question: John Marshall is best known for

choices.answer: being an NAACP lawyer during Brown v. Board of Education
creating judicial review/expanding powers of federal gov't
being a great U.S. General during the American Revolution
writing muckraking literature during the Progressive Era

questions.question: Which issue did the Virginia Plan, New Jersey Plan, and the Great Compromise address?

choices.answer: the system for electing the President
the method of determining state representation in Congress
the power to regulate interstate commerce
the number of justices on the Supreme Court

questions.question: The purpose of adding the Bill of Rights to the United States Constitution was to

choices.answer: strengthen the power of the Federal Government
assure the end of slavery
protect the people from abuse by the Federal Government
allow the adoption of new amendments

questions.question: An example of the use of the unwritten constitution is

choices.answer: a presidential veto
a president's cabinet meeting
creation of the United States Navy
use federal postal system

questions.question: The Louisiana Purchase had great geographic significance for the United States because it

choices.answer: reduced British control of North America
focused the United States on westward expansion
extended United States control over Mexico
decreased tensions with Native American Indians

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a part of the Compromise of 1850?

choices.answer: California entered the Union as the 16th free state
Slavery was kept in DC, but the slave trade was prohibited
Boundary set at the 49th parallel between US and Canada
Fugitive Slave Law; northerners had to return runaway slaves

questions.question: In their plans for Reconstruction, both President Lincoln and President Johnson sought to

choices.answer: punish the South for starting the Civil War
establish Republican Party as the only party in the South
force Southern States to pay reparations to the Federal Govt
allow the Southern States to reenter the nation quickly

questions.question: How were many African Americans in the South affected after Reconstruction ended in 1877?

choices.answer: A constitutional amendment guaranteed social advancement
The Freedmenâ€™s Bureau helped them become farm owners
Jim Crow laws placed major restrictions on their rights
Southern factories offered job training and employment

questions.question: The purpose of the Interstate Commerce Act, Sherman Antitrust Act & Clayton Antitrust Act was

choices.answer: to eliminate unfair business practices
to increase the power of local governments
to reduce imports from foreign nations
to reduce the power of the unions

questions.question: Initiative, referendum, recall and direct primary are all intended to

choices.answer: give political parties more control of the electoral process
reduce the influences of the media on elections
increase participation in government by citizens
make the president more responsive to the wishes of Congress

questions.question: Johnson's Great Society and FDR's New Deal both worked towards

choices.answer: opposing new immigration reform measures
expanding social welfare programs
relying on balancing the federal budget
reinstating government loyalty lists

questions.question: In New Jersey v. TLO ('85) and Vernonia School District v. Acton ('95), the Supreme Court ruled

choices.answer: schools need a court order to implement drug testing
student rights may be limited in school
school locker searches are unconstitutional
public schools have the right to promote school prayer
